channel.title: Developer Smackdown
channel.description: Developer Smackdown is a weekly technical audio podcast hosted by Clark Sell and Mark Nichols. Clark and Mark muse about anything related to the software industry and the developers behind it. On Developer Smackdown we try to not only give real world practical advice but have that honest conversation you would hae with your colleges after work. © Copyright 2009 – 2011 by Developer Smackdown.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Developer Smackdown with Clark Sell and Mark Nichols
channel.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
channel.itunes:summary: Mark Nichols and Clark Sell use their consulting experiences as a base for discussing how software is designed and created. The whole software development lifecycle is fair game and they won’t hesitate to smack down common practices and push forward a better way to develop software – in their eyes anyway!

item.title: Musing #64: Good Bye Brandon Satrom, Hello Brandon Satrom
item.description: Brandon and Clark rap about careers and how’s Brandon’s has lead him to Kendo UI. Oh yea, did we mention he’s leaving Microsoft.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Good Bye Brandon Satrom, Hello Brandon Satrom
item.itunes:summary: Brandon and Clark rap about careers and how’s Brandon’s has lead him to Kendo UI. Oh yea, did we mention he’s leaving Microsoft.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #63: Organizing a Conference with CodeManiacs Ian Randall and Ben Gracewood
item.description: In this episode, Clark and Mark talk across a lot of time zones to Ian Randall and Ben Gracewood about how to set up and organize a technical conference. Ian and Ben are creating “CodeMania” which is a developer’s conference slated for March 2012 in Aukland, New Zealand. This is an interesting behind-the-scenes view of what goes through the minds of organizers trying to create the ultimate technical discussion and learning environment.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Organizing a Conference with CodeManiacs Ian Randall and Ben Gracewood
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Clark and Mark talk across a lot of time zones to Ian Randall and Ben Gracewood about how to set up and organize a technical conference. Ian and Ben are creating “CodeMania” which is a developer’s conference slated for March 2012 in Aukland, New Zealand. This is an interesting behind-the-scenes view of what goes through the minds of organizers trying to create the ultimate technical discussion and learning environment.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #62: Arduino and Netduino with a Couple of Microcontroller Geeks
item.description: In this version, we grab a table at the local pub and talk microcontrollers. Brothers, Min and Lwin Maung walk us through the Arduino and Netduino revolution. By the end of the show, we decided to hack Clark’s garage door. We will save that for another show.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Arduino and Netduino with a Couple of Microcontroller Geeks
item.itunes:summary: In this version, we grab a table at the local pub and talk microcontrollers. Brothers, Min and Lwin Maung walk us through the Arduino and Netduino revolution. By the end of the show, we decided to hack Clark’s garage door. We will save that for another show.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #61: Live from HTML5.tx: Drifting Creatives destroys the DeveloperSmackdown.com website
item.description: We’re live from Austin TX at the epic HTML5.tx conference. In version 56 we asked the warriors from Drifting Creatives to blow up the DeveloperSmackdown.com site. They did exactly that! They walk us through what’s wrong, why they would change it. Of course they served us that plate of humble pie in front of 100 of our closest friends. After that Brandon and Clark talk about where the site should start adopting HTML5.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Live from HTML5.tx: Drifting Creatives destroys the DeveloperSmackdown.com website
item.itunes:summary: We’re live from Austin TX at the epic HTML5.tx conference. In version 56 we asked the warriors from Drifting Creatives to blow up the DeveloperSmackdown.com site. They did exactly that! They walk us through what’s wrong, why they would change it. Of course they served us that plate of humble pie in front of 100 of our closest friends. After that Brandon and Clark talk about where the site should start adopting HTML5.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #60: Talkin Twilio and Telephony with Keith Casey and John Sheehan
item.description: In this version Mark and Clark talk to Keith Casey and John Sheehan of Twilio. Keith and John are Twilio evangelists who talk to developers and help them create reliable and scalable voice and text messaging apps with Twilio technology.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Talkin Twilio and Telephony with Keith Casey and John Sheehan

item.title: Musing #59: Building HTML5tx.com with FrogSlayer's Sam Hooker
item.description: In this version Mark and Clark sit down with FrogSlayer’s Sam Hooker. We talk to Sam about how he took the creative built by Drifting Creatives and built HTML5TX.com.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Building HTML5tx.com with FrogSlayer's Sam Hooker

item.title: Musing #58: A few beers and JavaScript with Brandon Satrom
item.description: What do you do when your on the road at 1AM? Easy, talk about JavaScript after after imbibing on a few cocktails. Clark and Brandon explore the resurgence of JavaScript today and talk about a number of populate JavaScript tools. Brandon even decides to show off his beat boxing skills.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: A few beers and JavaScript with Brandon Satrom

item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #57: Turning on the LightSwitch with Jay Schmelzer
item.description: In this version Mark and Clark sit down with Microsoft Director Jay Schmelzer and talk about the newly released Visual Studio LightSwitch. Jay flips on the LightSwitch for us as he walks us through just what exactly Visual Studio LightSwitch is and how it all works.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Turning on the LightSwitch with Jay Schmelzer

item.title: Musing #56: Creating the HTML5tx.com design with Drifting Creatives Gavin Braman and Martin Hooper
item.description: In this version Clark and Mark sit down with Gavin Braman and Martin Hooper, founders, owners and warriors of Drifting Creatives. Gavin and Martin were the designers behind html5tx.com. Listen to us as we try crawling into their heads and see just how they came up with such badassery.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Creating the HTML5tx.com design with Drifting Creatives Gavin Braman and Martin Hooper

item.title: Musing #55: Kinecting with the Cosmos with Jonathan Fay, Dr. Mark SubbaRao & Michelle Yehling (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode (part 2), we complete the interview on location at Adler Planetarium. Mark and his guest cohost sister, Michelle (Nichols) Yehling talk to astronomer Dr. Mark SubbaRao of Adler Planetarium and Principal Software Architect Jonathan Fay of Microsoft Research about the details of developing the Worldwide Telescope, the conversion to Silverlight, Kinect in the WWT and future plans at Adler.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Kinecting with the Cosmos with Jonathan Fay, Dr. Mark SubbaRao & Michelle Yehling (Part 2)

item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #53: Building CTA Watch for Windows Phone with Matt Hidinger
item.description: In this show, Mark and Clark sit down with Matt Hidinger and talk about the building CTA Watch for Windows Phone 7. Matt discusses his experiences over this past year and shares a great deal of passion about the platform.

item.title: Musing #52: Application Security with Glenn Leifheit
item.description: In this episode, we talk to Glenn Leifheit, a Senior Information Security Consultant at FICO in Minneapolis-St. Paul, Minnesota about security – what to think about, where to start, approaches and best practices.

item.title: Musing #51: TDD with Keith Burnell
item.description: In this episode, we talk to Keith Burnell, a Software Engineer with Skyline Technologies in Green Bay, Wisconsin about a topic near and dear to all three of us: Test Driven Development.

item.title: Musing #50: Developer Smackdown is 2 and we just hit show #50!! How do you learn?
item.description: Thank you for the support, Developer Smackdown is 2!?!? Yes you heard it right. 50 shows in 2 years. Clark and Mark start the show musing a bit and then dive into how might you learn using NuGet as an example.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Developer Smackdown is 2 and we just hit show #50!! How do you learn?

item.title: Musing #49: Solus: Technology to Help with Peace of Mind
item.description: In this episode we get a little serious and talk to Nick Pearson, Mike Price and Nishanth Samala about an application they are working on to help friends and loved ones use targeted communications when a medical “situation” make things exceedingly difficult.

item.title: Musing #46: Unicorn Rhinos, Mexican Martini's, and 2 My Style Community Tacos
item.description: WARNING * WARNING * WARNING, this is a LONG show which is RAW and unfiltered. If you have small children present, you’ve been warned. During SxSW Clark sat down with Keith Casey, Jeff Blankenburg and Brandon Satrom and talked community. Each of us represent different technical communities and different areas across the United States. Clark attempts to get to the heart of what does and doesn’t work in their respective communities.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Unicorn Rhinos, Mexican Martini's, and 2 My Style Community Tacos

item.title: Musing #44: Umbraco with Warren Buckley
item.description: During SxSW Clark had a chance to sit down with Warren Buckley, front end developer with Umbraco. Clark and Warren muse everything Umbraco.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Umbraco with Warren Buckley

item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #43: Chewy Chong serves us some IE9 humble pie.
item.description: Clark managed to somehow transfer into the Redmond distortion field and meet up with an old friend, Chewy Chong. Chewy works on the IE9 team inside of Windows organization and serves us a delicious slice of IE9 humble pie. We have an honest conversation about today’s browsers, frameworks and the current state state of IE. Chewy explains what it means to us developers and site owners.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Chewy Chong serves us some IE9 humble pie.

Chewy works on the IE9 team inside of Windows organization and serves us a delicious slice of IE9 humble pie. We have an honest conversation about today’s browsers, frameworks and the current state state of IE. Chewy explains what it means to us developers and site owners.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #42: 3 Guys, 3 Helpers, NOT Three’s Company with Brandon Satrom
item.description: Clark and Mark sit down with Microsoft’s Brandon Satrom to talk through three very different implementations of an ASP.NET Helper. We dive into the dirty details of each and how come each implementation is just so different.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: 3 Guys, 3 Helpers, NOT Three’s Company with Brandon Satrom
item.itunes:summary: Clark and Mark sit down with Microsoft’s Brandon Satrom to talk through three very different implementations of an ASP.NET Helper. We dive into the dirty details of each and how come each implementation is just so different.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #41: http://bit.ly/TheSmackdownTalksToBitly with Matt LeMay
item.description: What’s the first rule of bit.ly?…You can’t bit.ly a bit.ly! Mark and Clark talk to Matt LeMay of Bit.ly about their API’s, the analytics that they provide, how they are used, how they fit in to the internet ecosystem and where they are hoping to go in the future.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: http://bit.ly/TheSmackdownTalksToBitly with Matt LeMay

item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #40: I NEED HELP, HELP, HELPERS
item.description: In this version, Mark and Clark muse about ASP.NET Helpers and NuGet. What are they, getting started and of course deploying.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: I NEED HELP, HELP, HELPERS
item.itunes:summary: In this version, Mark and Clark muse about ASP.NET Helpers and NuGet. What are they, getting started and of course deploying.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #39: The Name's Matrix, WebMatrix!
item.description: Clark and Mark talk about the release of the new web development environment from Microsoft called WebMatrix. As part of that discussion, they also talk about "Razor", the new view engine syntax. All of this wouldn't be complete without doing a comparison of the WebMatrix editing environment with Visual Studio and how they coexist. Helpers and the Nuget Gallery publishing environment help finish up the session.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell and Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: The Name's Matrix, WebMatrix!
item.itunes:summary: Clark and Mark talk about the release of the new web development environment from Microsoft called WebMatrix. As part of that discussion, they also talk about "Razor", the new view engine syntax. All of this wouldn't be complete without doing a comparison of the WebMatrix editing environment with Visual Studio and how they coexist. Helpers and the Nuget Gallery publishing environment help finish up the session.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #38: The unplugged history of 271447
item.description: In this off topic musing, Clark and Mark attempt to chat about Clark's professional career. It really didn't go how we thought it might when we talked about the idea in the first place, so why bother editing? We leave this one basically the way it got recorded. Have a behind the scenes look as we try to look inside Clark's career. Hopefully his badge still works after we publish this.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols

item.title: Musing #36: A year in the rear view mirror.
item.description: In this musing Mark and Clark reflect on a bit of history. We explore how Developer Smackdown got started, what we've liked and have a few laughs. One year down, many more to go.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols

item.title: Musing #35: Take 2-Catching Up: Talking Tech and Gearheading
item.description: In this musing, Clark and Mark catch up after a summer hiatus and talk about what's been happening - digital pens, Kinect, Windows Phone 7, cars, upcoming events, and a bunch of other ramblings.

item.title: Musing #30: Taking a REST with Scott Seely
item.description: Taking a little REST using .NET WCF. Scott Seely educates us on the use of .NET WCF within the world of REST, POX and URI's, .NET 4.0, REST vs. SOAP, HATEOAS vs. TUK, DataContract vs. XMLSerializable and more religious wars. This recording was done just minutes after a tornado touched down just outside of DS Studio North so as a result, we were all a little excited.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell and Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Taking a REST with Scott Seely
item.itunes:summary: Taking a little REST using .NET WCF. Scott Seely educates us on the use of .NET WCF within the world of REST, POX and URI's, .NET 4.0, REST vs. SOAP, HATEOAS vs. TUK, DataContract vs. XMLSerializable and more religious wars. This recording was done just minutes after a tornado touched down just outside of DS Studio North so as a result, we were all a little excited.

item.title: Musing #27: Application Architecture and PowerShell with Steven Murawski
item.description: In this version, Clark and Mark chat with Steven Murawski and talk a bit about PowerShell. This isn't a show about what PowerShell is but rather why it should be an upfront design tenant of everyone's application. architecture.

item.itunes:summary: In this version, Clark and Mark chat with Steven Murawski and talk a bit about PowerShell. This isn't a show about what PowerShell is but rather why it should be an upfront design tenant of everyone's application. architecture.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #26: Event Driven Architectures with Matt Long
item.description: We're getting deep with a discussion about Event Driven Architecture - what it is and what it can do. We're talking to our friend and Microsoft colleague Matt Long
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell and Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Event Driven Architectures with Matt Long
item.itunes:summary: We're getting deep with a discussion about Event Driven Architecture - what it is and what it can do. We're talking to our friend and Microsoft colleague Matt Long
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #25: Multi-Touch with Travis Feirtag
item.description: In this version, Clark and Mark sit down with Travis Feirtag and talk multi-touch. We explore the importance of user experience and what role multi-touch plays in applications today. Of course we dive into what that means to .NET. Listen along as we start touching UX.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Multi-Touch with Travis Feirtag
item.itunes:summary: In this version, Clark and Mark sit down with Travis Feirtag and talk multi-touch. We explore the importance of user experience and what role multi-touch plays in applications today. Of course we dive into what that means to .NET. Listen along as we start touching UX.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #23: Intro to OData
item.description: In this version of The Smackdown, Clark and Mark introduce OData. Our goal was to simply bring some awareness to what is this thing called OData and how can you start finding more information about it.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols

item.title: Musing #19: MIX10 - Live from MIX day 2 (official day 1)
item.description: Today we got to hear an amazing keynote at MIX10 about Silverlight 4.0 and Windows Phone 7 Series. Saw some really impressive demos of applications for the phone that were created in only 3 weeks. Then, went to some sessions talking about the phone, MVVM, app development and more.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell and Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: MIX10 - Live from MIX day 2 (official day 1)
item.itunes:summary: Today we got to hear an amazing keynote at MIX10 about Silverlight 4.0 and Windows Phone 7 Series. Saw some really impressive demos of applications for the phone that were created in only 3 weeks. Then, went to some sessions talking about the phone, MVVM, app development and more.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #18: MIX10 - Live from MIX day 1
item.description: Today is the pre-conference sessions and we talk about the new Silverlight 4.0 capabilities and a little about ASP.Net MVC 2.0.

item.title: Musing #17: Mix10 Smackdown - Were kicking off things.
item.description: In this musing Clark and Mark kick off their trip to the Microsoft Mix 2010 Conference in Vega$. We will explore some of the different techniques they use to navigate such a conference.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Mix10 Smackdown - Were kicking off things.
item.itunes:summary: In this musing Clark and Mark kick off their trip to the Microsoft Mix 2010 Conference in Vega$. We will explore some of the different techniques they use to navigate such a conference.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #16: Bamboozled in the Office
item.description: It's the first show of the new year and decade. Mark and Clark talk about, well, nothing that they planned on. The show gets bamboozled right from the start and the discussion turns toward where most development is done and that's in your office at home. We talk about what went into the design and what makes the office work from two similar but still different points of view.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Bamboozled in the Office
item.itunes:summary: It's the first show of the new year and decade. Mark and Clark talk about, well, nothing that they planned on. The show gets bamboozled right from the start and the discussion turns toward where most development is done and that's in your office at home. We talk about what went into the design and what makes the office work from two similar but still different points of view.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #15: Martin Woodward talks about Teamprise
item.description: In this version of The Smackdown Mark and Clark have the awesome opportunity to spend some time with Martin Woodward. Martin recently joined Microsoft as a result of the Microsoft Teamprise acquisition joining the Visual Studio ALM Suite of tools. Martin tells us all about getting his Microsoft chip installed as well as some Teamprise stuff too.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Martin Woodward talks about Teamprise
item.itunes:summary: In this version of The Smackdown Mark and Clark have the awesome opportunity to spend some time with Martin Woodward. Martin recently joined Microsoft as a result of the Microsoft Teamprise acquisition joining the Visual Studio ALM Suite of tools. Martin tells us all about getting his Microsoft chip installed as well as some Teamprise stuff too.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #14: Is Your Robot Looking At My Hinie?
item.description: Mark and Clark talk about doing home automation using Z-Wave and MS Robotics Studio. Clark wants to turn his house into a robot and they talk about how to get started with home automation. Tips and tricks include quickly changing editor font size in Visual Studio 08 - great support for code demos. Woopra web site analytics are also discussed.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Is Your Robot Looking At My Hinie?
item.itunes:summary: Mark and Clark talk about doing home automation using Z-Wave and MS Robotics Studio. Clark wants to turn his house into a robot and they talk about how to get started with home automation. Tips and tricks include quickly changing editor font size in Visual Studio 08 - great support for code demos. Woopra web site analytics are also discussed.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #13: Home Server and why we like it!
item.description: Clark and Mark explore how Windows Home Server joined their arsenal of computer hardware and software. Listen to why and how they both leverage Windows Home Server.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Home Server and why we like it!
item.itunes:summary: Clark and Mark explore how Windows Home Server joined their arsenal of computer hardware and software. Listen to why and how they both leverage Windows Home Server.
item.author: fans@DeveloperSmackdown.com (Clark Sell, Mark Nichols)

item.title: Musing #12: Are You Mocking Me?!
item.description: Mark and Clark talk about the use of mocks and stubs for unit testing. They define each and then talk about when they are best used. Tips and tricks include data driven testing using Excel and using Ping with IPV6 and IPV4.
item.itunes:author: Clark Sell, Mark Nichols
item.itunes:subtitle: Are You Mocking Me?!
item.itunes:summary: Mark and Clark talk about the use of mocks and stubs for unit testing. They define each and then talk about when they are best used. Tips and tricks include data driven testing using Excel and using Ping with IPV6 and IPV4.
